comments:
Build ID: I20070320-0010

Steps To Reproduce:
I ran UI tests 3 times. One time a have got failure named: The editor open trace was incorrect for testOpenTestFile. Other two runs, ended wtih no errors. The test might be non deterministic.

More information:

junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: The editor open trace was incorrect
	at junit.framework.Assert.fail(Assert.java:47)
	at junit.framework.Assert.assertTrue(Assert.java:20)
	at org.eclipse.ui.tests.multieditor.MultiEditorTest.testOpenTestFile(MultiEditorTest.java:172)
Are you running with any other plug-ins?

(In reply to comment #1)
> Are you running with any other plug-ins?
> 

I run it on clear Eclipse.

I've run these tests on my linux box (at home and work) plus they passed in the I build.

They can be sensitive to a locked screen or if anything else is going on in the system (i.e. you can't be doing anything else while these tests are running).

Do either of those scenarios seem likely?

PW

Oh, 2 more questions:

1) which version of GTK+?  Mine is:
bash-3.00$ rpm -q gtk2
gtk2-2.4.13-22

2) Do they fail if you run just the multi editor tests?  If they do, go to your junit-workspace right after and attach the .log file to the bug, please.

Thanx,
PW

I run this test by VNC and i don't lock screen and nothing else is going on the system. During tests i was one user of this system.

My gtk version is: gtk2-2.4.13-19

When i run just the multi editor tests they don't fail.

traces.message: The editor open trace was incorrect
